Reviews.Title: “Want to sleep in your closet?”
Reviews.Author: Asing
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely small which seems to be a common complaint. Mine was the size of a closet and faced a dirty inner courtyard. The staff was unfriendly. The breakfast staff were still adjusting their uniforms when the breakfast room opened at 7am and there was hardly anything ready at the buffet. Avoid if you are on business.

Reviews.Title: “All around good choice”
Reviews.Author: CathWat
Reviews.Content: We just completed a one-week stay at this hotel. We found it to be a great spot for exploring Rome, given its location next to a metro stop and many bus routes. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a larger room, which I'm sure made our stay more comforable. This hotel has terrific sound-proofing. Our room faced the street, but virtually all of the street noise was blocked. They served a generous breakfast in very pleasant surroundings. The hotel appeared to attract guests of all ages, including families, couples and business travelers. The front desk staff also gave us good advice on how to secure tickets to a Roma soccer match. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Piazza Barberini”
Reviews.Author: alehmen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was, as my previous research indicated, very well-located: 50m from Barberini subway station, walking distance to most attractions and a stop for many bus lines (which are very easy to take thanks to the excellent Roman public transportation website - http://www.atac.roma.it/) literally by the door. I stayed for a week and it was a perfect base to visit Rome. Staff speaks good English, rooms are small but nicely appointed and soundproof. In my first night I stayed at a room at the first floor: the view was partially obstructed by the hotel front sign and the bathroom had a foul odor coming out of the pipes. The following day I got a room on the 3rd floor and voilà, problems solved (even the carpet smelled better). The aircon tends to be too warm and it is hard to set the temperature you want. Pretty nice breakfast: no breakfast fried meats, which I think are disgusting anyway - much healthier options instead. Limited TV channels but the free WiFi more than makes up for it. Stendhal is not a luxury hotel, but it is quite stylish, especially the common areas. I booked my room through hotels.com with a promo code and got a 100 euro daily rate, which I think was pretty fair. Last but not least, I must mention the fact that, having to catch a red-eye flight home I had to leave at 4 am; Marco, who was in charge of the check-out, ran to the kitchen to fetch me some breakfast to go and handed it to me with a smile - very attentive of him.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Excellent location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LCQL
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Stendhal Hotel and we found it very well located, a few steps from the metro station, nice little restaurants and lounge bars around, waking distance from Spanish Plaza and Fontana di Trevi. The staff is very helpful and english was not a problem some of them speak spanish too. The only hickup was that upon arrival we found that they didn't have space for us....I guess they were overbooked so they sent us to another hotel, the second night we came back to Stendhal and they didn't have the category of room we booked so we had change room three times. One morning they had a bathroom problem in the same floor as us and they were making a lot of noise....they wanted to change our room for a forth time. Anyways, we ended up not moving anymore but other than that the people working there was extremly nice. The breakfast is limited for a non-lactose or meat person but coffee and tost was enough. The rooms a very clean, great choice if you want to see Rome because it's very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mydogfarley
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at the Stendhal twice, and I will happily return. It is perfect for business travel, and for soloists and couples. I wouldn't recommend it for families or anyone who needs to take up a lot of space. It has a great location just off the Piazza Barberini near the foot of the Via Veneto. The hotel is small but very well formed. The lounge and bar are lovely, and the staff have been great both times I've been there. The rooms are small, and this time the bathroom in my room had what was possibly the smallest shower cubicle I have ever used. But, everything is in good shape. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: fcd11
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in the Stendhal in early January 2012 with my teenage son. The hotel is cosy and most of the staff are friendly, but there was an unpleasant incident upon arrival: I had asked for a room with twin beds, since sleeping with my oversized teenage son in the same bed deranges my sleep too much (he moves a lot and takes up all the space). This request had simply been ignored and we were given a small room with a really small double bed. I complained but they had no other available rooms for the first 2 nights, so I had to endure 2 very bad nights indeed. On the 3rd day we were finally given a room with 2 beds; this room was much better and bigger than the first one. But it took a lot of insistence on my part and I didn't like it that they had just ignored my request to start with. The hotel is very well situated indeed, right in the middle of Rome, a short stroll away from Piazza di Spagna, Via Veneto and so many other attractions. Also very close to the Barberini subway entrance. Visiting the whole of Rome was a breeze given the location of the hotel. However, if you're expecting a 4-star level breakfast, you will be disappointed: the cereals are poor and the bread is white and tasteless. There were a couple of tiny little not-completely-white breadrolls on the table each morning, but every day I had to ask for more because we don't like the snow-white bread they serve, and every day they only brought one or two of the darker ones. We even had to resort to taking the leftover breadrolls from other tables after the people who hadn't eaten them left! On top of that, it was impossible to get chilled milk for the muesli. Every single day the milk was at lukewarm room temperature, even though I specifically asked for it to be taken from the fridge. After a while I understood they don't even put it in the fridge! So the daily breakfast was quite a bad experience. But apart from the breakfast problem, the hotel is recommendable, for its location and pleasant bourgeois atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel during England Rugby weekend and snow!!!`”
Reviews.Author: SAA26
Reviews.Content: Hi- 8 of us stayed at the hotel and had a brilliant time. Lovely rooms (although street can be a little noisy). Delicious breakfast. Incredibly kind and attentive staff. Good bar across the road. Definitely recommend the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: alessandro c
Reviews.Content: Finally, a true 4 star hotel in the very heart of Rome! While many supposed "4 stars hotel" in the center of Rome are literally dives you just want run away from, this delicious boutique hotel offered us a beautiful room, a very professional and polite crew (which is something very rare in Rome, unfortunately) and an elegant atmosphere. The hotel is located in the very heart of Rome, few steps far from the landmarks of the city. It was definitely a great surprise, my girlfriend and I will surely come back. Alessandro

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: LB879
Reviews.Content: I would totally recommend to sleep here, of you want a cheap, luxury, downtown hotel. Right across piazza barberini and Fontana Di trevi.

Reviews.Title: “Just Unacceptable...!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vetruvio1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Stendhal and we were welcomed by Damiano, the receptionist on the evening shift. We left our staff and went out and about in Rome to enjoy. We came back late at night exhausted from our trip too, and we noticed on our bedsheets that there were HAIR from previous clients and it was just disgusting. On the early morning hours, someone was banging the wall of our room nailing something or fixing something and it was sooo loud that we got scared and woke up suddenly. This went on for 20 minutes...We were so tired and we could not enjoy our sleep. We told the receptionist about the sheets, the noises in the morning complaining about the situation. We told him that we did not want a refund just a courtesy from the hotel to give us a ride to the airport at least. The receptionist after asking the manager (Mr. Campi) told us that the noise was not probably their fault but the fault of the building next door!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And for the sheets he apologized but he said that we already had got a room upgrade, so.... If you order an ice cream with strawberries and the strawberries are rotten then you don't blame the supplier of strawberries but the Gelato shop!!! If you have a hotel and accommodation is your product then you better ensure a pleasant and restful stay. So, the manager, through the receptionist gave us a discount of 15 Euros on the ride to the airport as an apology. Poor poor service and lack of hospitality!!! The room lacked of bathrobes, slippers and other convenient luxury that has become a standard for hotels of 4-5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all!!”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingdrums
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed at Hotel Stendhal by the friendly Damiano and the very polite porter showed us a great room. The actual bedroom was small but we had a walk-in wardroom, a well-equipped marble bathroom and (we had been upgraded!!) a fantastic terrace. On crisp sunny mornings and chilly evenings we enjoyed sitting out in the open. Our room was kept very clean and crisp bed linen changed every day. The breakfast, while not a big choice, was of high quality and the coffees (espressos and cappuccinos) wonderful. We are coffee snobs! The breakfast staff were polite and accommodating, no problem letting us linger over breakfast in library area and keeping up our coffee supply. There was free wi-fi, and staff were efficient and courteous. The hotel was in a great central location for our walks. We hope to return very soon. A lovely stay. No complaints at all!!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location but the room was so small”
Reviews.Author: loverhodeisland
Reviews.Content: we hardly could walk around the room as it was so tiny compared to the pics. but we were told that is how it is is Rome. The hotel was conveniently located and the breakfast was average compared to what we were used to in florence. stay here for convenience of location. staff at breakfast were not too polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on summer 2011 and as almost all reviews say, the rooms are quite small but they are very clean and comfortable. The location is superb and breakfast is enough for starting the day. The most important thing is the great help and attention you can get from the staff, specially from its manager Fabrizio. We used Rome as center for our 20 day trip to Italy and Mediterranean cruise. As you can imagine, we traveled with a lot of luggage since we were going for many days. The staff kindly let us leave some of our luggage with them while traveling to other cities in Italy and coming back to Rome and then while taking the cruise; this really helped us move around Italy more easily. I definitely recommend this hotel if you don't mind small rooms. Thanks a lot Fabrizio!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Pam I
Reviews.Content: Great location (we walked from the train station and its close to a metro stop as well) with Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps a short walk away. Room was on the small side but not a hinderance to my husband, me and our 14 month old. Still plenty of room for us. Pay attention to room size when booking (we used booking.com which lists the size of each room in square meters). Clean and tidy and cot made for our son. Breakfast was adequate and included hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit and pastries. Breakfast area could get crowded but tables were cleared promptly so not an issue. Reception and all hotel staff we came in contact with were absolutely lovely! So helpful for making dinner reservations and giving directions and suggestions. Bed was comfortable. Nice water pressure and bathroom. We faced the back of the hotel (so away from the street) and enjoyed peace and quiet even with our window open a touch for fresh air. Lovely visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: Assaf L
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome (My wife and I) for 4 nights 24/11-28/11 and enjoyed every minute of it. We ordered a regular room and the hotel upgraded us free no charge to superior :-) The Hotel is new, clean and very warm, the staff are always helpful and do it with a smile There's free WiFi (You need to renew the free user/password) and we could Skype with our daughters, Breakfast is also nice. Everything was ok, hot water, safe, TV, no noise from the street below. The main thing is the location, we walked to all attractions, no need for a taxi or metro at all. The room was clean each day and we feel we did the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Bobby086
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stendhal in My 2011. Location of the hotel is fantastic, close to the public transport and some great sights including Trevi fountain, Spanish steps. The breakfast provided a good variety of cereals and the pastries were lovely. Good sized bathrooms and even provided scales which isn't so good after eating your way around Italy ;) The bed was very comfortable. The room was a little on the small side however was perfectly adequate. Staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roger H
Reviews.Content: great hotel, easy to find, very central location within walking distance of most major sights hotel staff was very courteous and friendly and the room was immaculate very pleased--will definitely stay here again on a future trip

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OldMillAnna
Reviews.Content: The good news - great location, just off Piazza Barberini, very close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain and great shopping on Via Veneto. As well, the hotel is beautifully decorated and looks to be recently renovated. Beautiful breakfast/bar area and friendly, courteous staff. The bad news - my room was gorgeous but miniscule. I know that a single room in Europe means small but this one was smaller than usual - to be able to move about the room, I had to park my suitcase in front of the door - upside, added security feature!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service; on busy street”
Reviews.Author: suehagan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Stendhal Oct. 31-Nov. 2, 2011. We got a great rate through our travel agent, and were past peak season, so the value was not bad. Located between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain, all the historical sites were within pretty easy walking distance. Service is fantastic; the hotel is small, but staff was willing to hold our luggage for eight hours after checkout so we could take advantage of our last day in Rome. Rooms are small; (the on-line pictures make them look larger, so be aware of that). Our bathroom had a nice tub/shower combo, but another couple traveling with us could barely turn around in their tiny shower. Rooms are beautifully clean and nicely appointed however. My only complaint is that the hotel is on a busy street, with a bus stop right in front. The constant stops and starts of the buses, plus the diesel fumes, are bothersome if you keep your window open. With the window shut tightly, the noise is virtually blocked out. I would stay there again, but I like small boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond 4 stars standard”
Reviews.Author: goodmankl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 years ago, come back again this summer. Breakfast: good food, good service. Room: size better than many other 4 stars hotels in europe Service: I didn't ask but (1) free internet (2) advanced to a higher floor room Location: best, central area, within all points of attraction; close to metro. Improvement made. Very good !

Reviews.Title: “Great location; try a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: activeseniorsKelowna
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Stendahl for seven nights. We were unsure where to stay in Rome and were pleased that we chose this hotel. It is a small "boutique" hotel and easy to miss on the busy Via del Tritone. The rooms are compact (small) but are impeccably clean and well serviced. One might consider the 400 Euros per night on the pricey side, but by Rome standards we believed we still received value for money. The room we had was a standard double and was surprisingly quiet. Air-conditioning worked well and we did not leave windows open to a busy noisy street.The included continental breakfasts were generous, with delicious variety and were nicely presented. The hotel is exceptionally well located in north-central Rome, within a healthy walking distance of major piazzas, sites, and trendy shops and restaurants. It is near the Piazza Barberini and a convenient Metro stop. Location is a definite plus. The Front Desk staff were usually friendly and helpful; a non-smoking policy was welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but small”
Reviews.Author: Jay D
Reviews.Content: Pros: central location, very clean, well decorated, secure, quaint lobby with small lounge, bar, internet, printer Cons: can be loud, staff is a bit uptight, regular rooms are small even by Rome's standards

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruno90
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the Stendhal Hotel and it was a very pleasant experience. The staff were very professional, attentive and helpful. The room spacious, comfortable and nicely decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room overlooked the Via Tritone and was exceptionally quiet. All sights were easily accessible on foot. We intend to return to this hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robin A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. It's beautifully decorated & very clean. The staff was accommodating & for the most part very pleasant! The heating/cooling system worked very well. Our room was right on the street which is very busy, so if you're a light sleeper you won't do well if you leave the window open at night, but with it shut, I didn't find the traffic disturbing. The breakfast was fine.....nothing fancy but more than adequate. The bar stays open until midnight so we were able to have a nightcap most nights if we wanted one. Location was great for almost everything....we even walked all the way back from the Vatican and most of the way back from Trastevere, though both are a bit of a hike. If you're going to find your way around, get a GOOD map though.....the street names in Rome are crazy and minor street names change every couple of blocks so you need to really pay attention. If I wanted a centrally located hotel, I would definitely stay here again......not cheap, but then, nothing in Rome is!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: flo l
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stendhal Hotel late October 2010 for 5 days. The hotel is absolutely beautiful! It has a perfect mixture of new and old furnishings which truly brings you into the Italian spirit. The room was pretty small, and our view (at the back of the hotel) was not the best, however we did not spend a huge amount of time looking out of the room window, rather than exploring Rome! The hotel itself is small, however I think this gave it a really lovely intimate feel. All the staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. They always put the customer first - at one point we came back to the hotel at the end of the day, and one of the staff members offered the lift to us, despite the fact that he had an entire tray of drinks to carry up the stairs! The room (despite being small as I said above) was lovely. We stayed in a standard double room, and it had everthing we needed. I am very fussy with hotels, and if I stay somewhere that is ugly I get very home sick and want to leave - as soon as I got to the room I felt 100% comfortable and at home - I actually felt very emotional once the trip came to an end and we had to leave. The only food we had to eat at the hotel was breakfast - it was continental and very tastey. The location was perfect! We were not entirely sure of the location when we booked. As niether of us had ever been to Rome before we assumed we would need to travel from the hotel to the sites via local transport. Well we were wrong, the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Step and Condotti were at most a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The longest walk we did was to the Vatican - which was a 45 minutes walk. This was fine for us! There are many great restuarants close to the hotel - all reasonably priced and serve delicous food! I have recommended this hotel to family members and would recommend it to anyone who wants to go to Rome to explore the sites and eat fantastic local food.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: JerrypHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Helpful and friendly staff with much better English than our Italian. We we glad to have chosen the "Superior" room with it's extra space for our 4 night stay after checking out other reviewers beforehand. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom, clean with a very good shower. A more than adequate breakfast was provided to set you up for the day's sightseeing, including excellent coffee, but then we're British and any coffee is going to taste good compared to what we are used to! Possibly the best hotel in Rome - a great location and one we are happy to recommend to anyone looking for something a little special.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: 59canadian
Reviews.Content: Every single detail from chamber service to great breakfasts was tended to with a smile and genuine care. The staff were all excellent, gave directions answered questions from all of us tourists, with great details and information. Bed was great, as was bedding, shower pressure and TV had English, Italian, German and Arabic stations. We stayed in Rome for 6 days at the Stendhal. Would definitly return! Not one thing was lacking in the entire trip. Breakfast was much more than expected: eggs, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt and a great variety of breads and cereals. Email service was convenient and free when using their computer. It was refreshing not to have to spend 6 Euro just to touch base occasionally with home. The location was fantastic, so convenient to majority of sites. Just around the corner from the Trevi and a fabulous selections of restaurants...many places within a stones throw to get great coffees and the Metro. Buses are not as convenient as the Metro. Check into 3 day passes. Probably will serve you well, saves some mileage on those feet...you'll need all of the foot pampering you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: LorraineT808
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located near the metro, Trevi Fountain, and Spanish Steps. Take the metro to get to the Coliseum -- it was very easy to use. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Our room was a double deluxe but small by American standards. The hotel was very clean and quiet. The breakfast was very good and the availability of a computer for guest use was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value for money and nicely decorated.”
Reviews.Author: Forsterfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in a standard room. We really enjoyed our stay and thought that the property offered the following benefits: Location - most of the 'big ticket' sites are within walking distance of this hotel. For example, the Spanish Steps are only 5 - 10 minutes away. There is a wide range of quality restaurants in the area, the bus pulls up out the front and the taxi bay is across the road. Value for money - hotels are generally pretty expensive in Rome and this one is no exception. But we thought that the complimentary breakfast each morning was very good value and had a decent and quality range of food. Comfort and 4-star standard - the room was on the small-ish side but extremely comfortable and very nicely decordated. The bathroom was also modern luxe and offered a quality range of toiletries. Downstairs, the breakfast room was beatifully decorated and peaceful. We would definitely stay here again on our return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: RomainLouise
Reviews.Content: the room was very very small even by Rome standard. Via Del Tritone is a busy street. But most disappointing was the room we got was smaller than the one they sold us through their deal. Don't get fooled by their deal. The breakfast was uninspired.

Reviews.Title: “We will only stay here on all future trips to Rome”
Reviews.Author: WorldWanderer24
Reviews.Content: (1) The decoration and design of the hotel is excellent. It looks fresh, new, and a good blend of modern yet classic. Many complain of the small size of Rome hotels... I felt they made an excellent use of their space here. (2) The dress and demeanor of hotel staff was excellent throughout the stay--from the check-in people to the serving people. (3) The room was well furnished. The bathroom was excellent: new, well lit, and very much inviting. There was even a great tub in there! A/C was strong, and there was wireless throughout. They even turned down the bed without us asking. (4) Breakfast was excellent. The eating room was on the entry floor and had one wall of windows facing the street, whereas the interior was decorated very well. The selection for breakfast was ample and bread excellent. (5) Location was amazing. Metro stop (Barberini) and a taxi stand are a 2 minute walk. But even better, you can get to Trevi Fountain in a 10 min casual stroll, and then the Parthenon in 15 and Plaza Navona in 20 min max. (6) Last, I had to stay at another hotel on my way back through Rome and wow, Stendhal really is amazing and offers good rates (we stayed Sun-Mon-Tue for €139/night). Do stay here if you can! Btw, we did the enjoyrome.com walking tour, given our limited time in Rome--and found it very worth it (combination tour of the Vatican and Ancient & Old Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Good service and good central location”
Reviews.Author: Eddball
Reviews.Content: Service at the Hotel Stendhal was first rate. Friendly and available to help. Damiano on reception provided us with a great recommendation for dinner on our first night with genuine enthusiasm and delight (not just on the fact he probably made an extra euro or two from the restaurant on the side). The Hotel is small , rooms are small ,tidy and clean.It has some character but not in a lavish way. Practical and great location for our long weekend where a bed and bathroom are all that was required as we spent most of our time out in Rome. Hotel door is 5 mins walk either way to the Trevi fountain or the Spanish Steps. No complaints got what we paid for with good service.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kissanpentu
Reviews.Content: I can recommed this hotel. People were helpful, breakfast was good, location excellent. Four stars could be five stars.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: cathinunn
Reviews.Content: This was our very first time in Rome and this hotel was fabulous! From the time we arrived, everyone there was very friendly and helpful! It was really nice to have the bar in the evening to refresh ourselves from our daytime activities. We met some very lovely people that were also hotel patrons while having our evening cocktails. The hotel is centrally located within a few minutes to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, the metro is a quick hop, skip and a jump (so close). We walked all over Rome in a days time to the Vatican and ending up at the Villa Borghese Park (which in my opinion is one of the most beautiful places in Rome!) Piazza Barberini is right a few steps away and there are several lovely restaurants in the area. We found alot of wonderful places to eat off of the main roads and on the small alley like streets. Our room was right on the street and I loved opening the shutters at all hours and watching and listening to all of the activity - it was a definite dream come true visiting Rome! I highly recommend this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: designer10California
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stendhal for 5 nights and had a very positive experience. The location was great -- 10 minute taxi ride from the train station (30 minutes from the airport), steps from the Barbarini Metro stop and a ten minute walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. We got the standard room which was teeny tiny, but clean and fine for us since we barely spent time in the room. We were given a room facing the front of the hotel initially, but it was much too noisy due to the traffic outside. We were moved to the back of the building which had no view, but was very quiet. The small breakfast room off the lobby was very cozy and the breakfasts were great (big basket of croissants and pastries, yogurt, eggs, cheeses etc...). The Wi-Fi didn't work very well in the rooms (you get a free code from the front desk), but there is one computer in the lobby for the guests to use that has free and fast internet service. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We would recommend the Stendhal -- just beware that rooms in Rome are tight. If space is what you need, then definitely upgrade to a superior or suite. The standard rooms barely have space to open two suitcases and be able to walk around the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: liliwright
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with this hotel. It's really conveniently situated: a 1 minute walk to Barbarini metro station and less than 10 minutes walk to the Trevi fountain. The hotel was clean and the staff were really friendly and always happy to help. A good breakfast was provided every morning which kept us going well into the afternoon. There were also a number of good restaurants nearby. A great hotel that we would definitely stay at again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miman44
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect as this hotel was recommended to us by Costco travel. The staff was most courteous and special thanks to the staff that handled our breakfast. They were very nice! Also, our plan included the breakfast buffet. For a European breakfast, they had a nice selection. For a small hotel, the furnishings were very elegant and clean. With a family a 4, they assigned 2 rooms for us and our kids felt safe. The hotel is centrally located and is almost 5-10 minutes away from the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Villa Borghese park. Although it is located on a busy street, the noise didn't bother us at night time. I highly recommend this place for the vicinity, hotel comfort and breakfast buffet. If we were able to go back to Rome, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view.”
Reviews.Author: kathyanddanny
Reviews.Content: We are in the stendhall as we speak.... Great little boutique hotel that our travel agent recommended. Front desk very efficient, wonderful room!! With pretty little terrace. Right in the heart of the city. A short walk to the trevie fountain and Spanish steps. The best! Free Wi Fi! Very nice bathroom fascilities and the bed is like sleeping on a large comfy pillow. We would certainly recommend this little gem to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Sir we have a small problem with your room”
Reviews.Author: BowieFamily
Reviews.Content: Not what you want to hear when you are checking in late with the wife, three year old and 15 month old. Turns out one of interconnecting rooms was not available due to someone refusing to move out. Anyway, we ended up squeezing into one superior room which they did at an exceptional discount for us and the rest of our stay was lovely. The rooms are of a high standard and look just like the web photos. They aren't huge but we survived and believe me we aren't traveling light (double pram, gear for the kids plus we have two weddings on this trip so I even have a suit and the wife has a selection of dresses and multiple shoes)! Staff were very friendly especially mossimo at the bar. The location is also superb. You are only a short walk from Spanish steps, Trevino fountain and not that far a walk even from the colosseum (but then we are used to walks with the kids). I would highly recommend this groovy hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely dissapointing and untrustable”
Reviews.Author: vivitena
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for two rooms and when we got there they told us that we were booked out and that they would had to send us to another hotel. They sent us to a very mediocre and badly located hotel called EMPIRE PALACE HOTEL. Cristiano at the front desk was a very disrespectful, unhelpful and unkind man. I wouldn´t recommend any of these hotels; one of the reasons being that you can´t trust that your reservation will be honored and the other because of the service and location.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING SERVICE, LOCATION AND PRICE”
Reviews.Author: PrivateItalyToursLtd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Stendhal, as have over 30 of our clients, over the past 12 months and everyone, to a person, has raved about the service, location and fair price of this hotel. Located on the Via del Tritone in the center of Rome, the cacophony of the streets disappears behind you as you enter the lovely small lobby area. The lobby bar and public areas of the hotel, while small, are more than comfortable and clean. The rooms are medium size for Rome, offer amenities and services that easily support their four star rating. The breakfast service offers some items that most Italian hotels do not; hot egg dishes and a larger than 'normal' breakfast buffet. If you are looking for a comfortable, private and lovely hotel in the heart of Roma, look no further...stay at the Stendhal!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: OleManMoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, lovely place, service excellent, breakfast very good, in a great spot not far from metro and Trevi Fountain and plenty of restaurants. Staff were very helpful and there was always someone on the counter who spoke or understood English (maybe not Australian).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wineanytime
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 3 days at the Stendahl coming back from a week in Tuscany. We checked in with a not-so-friendly Suraj and it seemed like we were bothering him cause he was on the phone. The room was small but well appointed and the bathroom was great. The service could have been better as we came back to our room with only one set of towels. When we called up for another set, it took a long time. The breakfast is so-so. The location of the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel we would recommend to anyone visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: Davies2606
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Stendhal is in a perfect location for visiting all the major sites - Spanish Steps, trevi Fountain etc and close to the Metro. The hotel is decorated to a very high standard with good quality rooms, bathrooms and excellent service. We stayed at the back of the hotel and even though the view was the back of other buildings, the room was quiet and perfectly cool. The breakfast is simple and plentiful and the staff are very helpful. A great hotel to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: lena08121956
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights. The room itself was small but I knew that. However, all the amenities were all in there, except it could do with bathrobes. It was also extremely close to all the major attractions and it was nice to be able to walk to the Fountain of Trevi each day to start the day. The decor was lovely and it felt like a real boutique experience. The hotel staff at all times were friendly and willing to help you with anything. Going back to the hotel each day from a day's sightseeing or shopping was like going back home and staff always greeted you with a smile. Breakfast was nice but would have been nice to have perhaps some more variety but on the whole it was very a very good expereince. Would go back but next time have an executive room which is a little larger and would be happy to pay the extra. Expensive but you got what you paid for, boutique hotel, superior service and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “The Stendhal Hotel, a Roman Oasis”
Reviews.Author: MsSCTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Stendhal in May 2011. Our disappointment in finding our room did not have the requested balcony was quickly turned to pleasure through the efforts of the staff, especially Suraj. He arranged to have us moved to the only room with a sizeable walled patio/terrace on the 6th floor--Room 601. The extra charge was well worth having this "second" room--complete with flowering plants, a large umbrella-covered table, and lots of walking-around space. Because the weather was so beautiful and mild, we were able to keep the terrace doors open while in the room. It was also a perfect place for our own "picnic" with lunch purchased from a nearby restaurant. The room had the usual fridge, TV, and sufficient closets. The room and bathroom were clean and carefully maintained during our visit. Kudos to all the staff. They were always polite--with real smiles--and helpful in arranging and instructing cab drivers, wonderful restaurants and even making calls within Italy to help us with a minor problem from a previous stay. It was so relaxing to come back to the Hotel and escape the city hubbub and enjoy a cocktail and snacks in the intimate bar off the lobby. After just one visit, the bartender/mixologist remembered the drink order (but he always verified our choice) and made sure there were some tasty treats to go along with the cocktails. The breakfast buffet was served in the same area and was the traditional European selection. Here, too, the staff was able to remember your name and usual choice of juice and hot beverage. As they used to say in the TV show "Cheers"--everyone knows your name at the Hotel Stendhal. While the hotel itself is wonderful, the location makes it even more so. It is so close to the many main attractions of Rome. While there are many within walking distance, there are others that require a cab. Overall, this is a great location for anyone visiting Rome. We would go back to the Stendhal Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Rome255100
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in May and thought this was a delightful boutique hotel in a very good position the staff were pleasant and although we were not able to get into our rooms until quite late they did look after our luggage for us. We returned to the hotel 2 weeks later for our last night in Rome before heading home only to be told the room we had booked and paid for months ago was no longer available to us as they were a small hotel and needed the room for people from the previous night. They had booked us into a large hotel which was most disappointing and no amount of protesting was listened to, we were whisked into a cab within minutes of our arrival barely having time to finish the coffee I had asked for while I digested this news. I will not be recommending this hotel as after a day traveling the last thing you need is an upset like this.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for value”
Reviews.Author: idobr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Stendhal during the first week of June. Overall the experience was nice, the staff is very friendly and likes to help, the location is great, the room was clean. The only negative comment I have is the price. We payed around $500 US for night which seemed to me too expensive for what we got. For example, the TV in the room was small, breakfast selection was small.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Lucyna_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located close to the main Roma attrcations. Friendly service & clean rooms. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Like being a guest in a friend's house after a tiresome exciting day”
Reviews.Author: Knikol
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights after having a terrible experience in another Rome hotel. After such a lousy stay, Stendhal felt like heaven. To begin with, the location is top and although Via del Tritone is a busy street we heard no noise. The room itself wasnt that big yet big enough, the bathroom was great but unfortunately no bathrobes(it would have been an absolute treat to have them) and the whole boutique feeling was splendid. Breakfast was on a service basis unique but it felt short on variety, possibly due to lack of space. Going back, we can only describe our stay at Stendhal as being in a mellow mood for 2 days, mainly thanks to everyone working there. They are professionals in the best sense of the word( sorry for not mentioning any names, we dont want to embarass the shy one :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: michael_torres
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Stendhal was a great place to stay! We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed everything about the hotel. Very clean and located in the perfect location...walking distance to everything. The breakfast served every morning was a great way to start the day. We'll stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, updated small rooms, decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Red_Betty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Stendhal 5 nights. Good location only 10-15 minutes from the Spanish Steps/shopping/restaurants. The rooms are quite small, but I understand that this the norm in Rome. They are updated and well decorated, with everything but robes. The hotel is small, with only 4-5 small rooms on each floor. The lobby, kitchen, elevator bank and breakfast area/bar are squeezed into the same 4-5 room space on the first floor, so it's tight. But it is well decorated and clean. The breakfast is below what I would expect: canned fruit, deli meats, scrambled eggs and pastries. But the coffee is made fresh. I enjoyed my stay, but was not overwhelmed. The desk gave poor recommendations for restaraunts on the Via Veneto. Overpriced, bad service - especially restaurant Il Conte Di Galluccio. Don't go. Maybe the recommendations were for friend's establishments, but they were the worst we had. Try Restaurant 34 near Spanish Steps. I ate there 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a great location and recently updates”
Reviews.Author: 2lilly2
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel for it's location. At 278.00 euros a night it is much more affordable than the hotels on the Via Veneto. The rooms are a little small but it's been updated. The breakfast is included and is decent. The staff is nothing special, just doing their jobs. Though I would stay away from their restaurant recommendation. The restaurant they recommended was the worst restaurants we ate at in Italy. The name of this restaurant is Il Conte Di Galluccio. It's around the corner from the hotel on the Via Veneto. The service was miserable and it did not stop them from adding a 15% service fee. I would avoid the restaurants on the Via Veneto. They are expensive and tourest traps. We went to a restaurant called L'Osteria de "Memmo" recommender by our guide. We would have never found it. It was very good and not very expensive. Also restaurant 34 near the Spanish Steps is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, well-located, but not 4-star”
Reviews.Author: FromNYCtoTheWorld
Reviews.Content: This was a well-located hotel, cute decor, staff was friendly, and it suited my purposes. However, my room had a funny smell to it (perhaps a lot of stale cigarette smoke), and the window faced an inner alley-way, so I could not get fresh air in the room. The carpet looked like it could be replaced, and the breakfast left something to be desired. It wasn't a great value for the price (not cheap), and felt like it was trying but wasn't quite there.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: anutaNY
Reviews.Content: It will be one of the bad good reviews. I cannot say that Stendhal was a bad hotel; it just did not work for me. The good things: nice personnel, clean rooms, nice breakfast area, free wifi, and central location near a train station. Now on to the things that were not so good: because it was facing busy via Tritone the windows had to be closed all the time and because the room was small it became stuffy very fast even though it wasn’t hot outside, so we had to turn on the AC. The windows had shutters and heavy drapery that made the room very dark, which would keep the room cool during hot Roman summer but it had a very depressing effect overall. Breakfast selection was very bad, somehow even pastries managed to be unappetizing. Carpet in our room looked pretty dirty. Overall it just felt like it was trying to be a great hotel but was missing the mark…

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful hotel and so central”
Reviews.Author: triciafromoz
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, so close to all attractions, close to drop off spots for all major tourist buses. Marco on the Front Desk was wonderful, recommended some great restaurants close by. Small boutique hotel offering a lovely breakfast in the morning, great service. Only drawback was that the room was very warm, tried opening the windows but it was a bit noisy at night. This hotel is within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in the middel of rome.”
Reviews.Author: onmytravels10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome staying at the Stendhal hotel for the weekend for my husbands birthday. We had a fantastic stay. The hotel staff were very welcoming and we appreciated the extra length they went to making our stay extra special for a special birthday. Rooms though small, were very comfatable, quiet, extremely clean, contemporary with modern but classy decor. Great breakfast and bar area. Overall a great hotel in a central location, less than 5 minutes walk from the spanish steps, trevi fountain and 100 metres from a metro stop for ease of transfer to and from the airport. We would like to take this opportunity to thank the owners and staff at the hotel for a wonderful and enjoyable stay. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if i'm lucky enough to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Female Flying Solo - What a Secure Yet Scenic Experience Stendhal Is!”
Reviews.Author: doncaster
Reviews.Content: Last I visited Rome, I was a young lass on the cusp of 20 and I can remember having to memorise terms like 'il gabinetto' for toilet and lots of finger pointing at food items as the Italians then spoke no English. This time, as a female executive from Australia-Pacific, I memorised a few common Italian words off youtube and was plesantly surprised when Seruj from the front desk greeted me in impeccable English. Everything you see depicted on the Hotel Stendhal's website is as what the reality is. For my week-long stay, key on my list of priorities was a safe and secure place that I could spend 6 nights in decent, boutique surroundings that resorts around Asia spoil you with. My double bed (queen-sized) was so comfortable, turning in at night was actually a highlight! I am a terribly light sleeper, blame it on 2 kids under 6, and sleep with earplugs, but I swear, my room in the back of the hotel was so silent, I spent many evenings enjoying the breeze drifting in from my shuttered windows flung wide open to enjoy the white noise of sirens and roosting birds that now is but a memory of Rome. The room is indeed small but comfortable and immaculately put together (particularly appreciated the bathtub). If you like the gentrified baroque/ country look you see on the website, the guests, it appears, are equally discreet like the surroundings. The rooms beside me were occupied but apart from whispered comings and goings, everyone was civilised and genteel, mostly the 30-50 something set. And the best part - the hotel was a stone's throw away to where my daily meetings were in the gregorian university 30 steps away from Trevi Fountain. In 3-4 minutes flat, I'm there, and that was such a luxury, enjoying Rome and its glorious attractions all a stone's throw from my nightly base. I ventured too to the Spanish Stairs, (love the cavernous underground MacDonald's there - who'd have imagined, Macker's comfort food after too much pasta and pizza), and the Pantheon is but about an easy 10-minutes stroll. I particularly appreciated the free wireless access, broadband streaming was fine most days that I stayed in to do work, but room service (was shockingly high - 30 euros for a pizza!) I hightailed it to the many cafes that are a mere 30-second walk from Stendhal. Kudos too to the service from the suave Seru,j, (Indian from Maldives), I loved the global feel of present-day Italy with Anglo-Indian tour guides and Turkish vendors and mainland Chinese souvenir sellers. Reminded me just of multiracial Singapore and multicultural Melbourne :) Thanks too to the fabulous waiter, (sorry didn't get your name, was it Fabio?), at breakfast every morning who knew exactly what this madame wanted - orange jiuce and a perfectly made cappucino in the serene and elegant breakfast rooms reminiscent of a bygone era - what a perfect start to the day! Ciao Roma, Madam Adeline.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here and recommend to anyone in a heartbeat!~”
Reviews.Author: cferrara
Reviews.Content: The rooms were SPOTLESS! The staff was lovely and MORE than helpful. The breakfast was over the top- I cannot say enough nice things about the Stendhal. My next trip back to Rome- I will be staying here, no questions asked!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: panospapag
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Stendhal and our memories would only be good from this hotel.The rooms are really small but they are so well decorated that we did not mind at all about the size of our room.We stayed in a standard double room with great views to the Piazza Barberini and we also had a small balcony which was great.The breakfast was good quality, not so many choices but anyway it offered a good start of the day.The location is central and ideal for visiting almost all the important sites in Rome, especially because there is a metro station 2 mins walk away.But bare in mind that the hotel is located in a busy street so do not expect to sleep in total silence.There is noise from the road in front of the hotel and from bars and restaurants nearby even in late at night and early morning hours.What we did not like about the hotel is that the personnel in the breakfast room the did not speak english at all and even when i was saying to them that i do not speak italian they continued talking to me in italian.I would expect from a 4 star hotel all the staff to speak english.I would definately recommend this hotel to everyone who want a short break in Rome, it was really a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly lovely hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: franjmc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Stendhal previously, in 2005 and so had no doubts about staying again. The location is really the best thing, right on Via del Tritone, and within walking distance of all the things Roma had to offer. Even for an overweight 40 something :) The hotel is small, but beautifully clean and smells lovely. It's serviced a couple of times a day, and all the staff are courteous and helpful. I sent MANY emails to them in the months leading up to our trip and they were all answered quickly and politely, although I'm sure they were sick to death of me by the time we arrived. The beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are well appointed, with a desk, mini bar, enough cupboard space and lovely bathroom with good quality toiletries. The staff were happy to recommend restaurants, and arranged a great private guide for us, which we thoroughly enjoyed. We enjoyed a drink most evenings in the bar and were entertained by the bar man, who's name has escaped me :( Patrizio, Marco and Suraj at the front desk are all perfectly polite and go out of their way to help. I honestly can't understand why the Stendhal isn't rated higher on TA, but it deserves to be. I'm planning to return in 2015 and will be booking a room at the Stendhal again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good! Ekegant and fancy”
Reviews.Author: Fernanda10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located and is very beautiful. The room is not very big ut is OK, the breakfast is very good! The hotel is excelente for who is traveling with husband/friends. Don't miss!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stendhal would return excellent service”
Reviews.Author: elizabethhc
Reviews.Content: On arrival staff were friendly we received a free upgrade to a lovely room with a terrance. Room appeared as it was on the internet brochure, the hotel was a small hotel total of six flours in an adapted but original building. We requested extra blankets and pillow which were delieved within minutes. Also provide a good map of the area and ringed their suggested places to visit. When asked also recommended nice places to eat. The breakfast provided was standard buffet breakfast, but in elegant surroundings. The whole hotel was very clean and well kept, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Ludivine011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights and had a fantastic experience. Excellent location, lovely rooms and decor, very attentive staff. We'll definitely be back and will be recommending it to friends for the perfect Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoteladvisorbs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegant, so the room and the crew. I liked a lot the hotel and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay for 4 nights at the Stendhal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alison186460
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable. As big as you would expect in a European Hotel. Staff were extremely pleasant and attentive. The position was great for the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. We like to walk around cities to get the feel of the them and made it easily to the all the sites including the Vatican by cutting across from the Spanish Steps and down the Via Condotti and across the bridge. Only downside would be the traffic noise but that is a city for you and especially Rome. Would recommend a stay here and had some great meals close by and a few coffees and liquers in Pepys Bar across the street. Great experience. From Wales

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around...”
Reviews.Author: Drumman48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our honeymoon and stayed here for 6 days. From the time we walked in, the staff was impecable, helpful, and friendly. The breakfast was more than one would expect in a european hotel. It is centrally located with the Metro about 200 meters away, the Hard Rock Cafe around the corner, and most of the city's sites within walking distance (except the zoo, which was quite the hike). At the end of the day, enjoy your favorite potable in their lounge. It was truely one of the best hotels I've had the pleasure of staying in. I have been in 5 star hotels that could not even compare. Thanks for a great trip, Stendhal!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: crissy420
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay, albeit, for one night only. The hotel is like being on the inside of a Tiffany's box (I mean that in a good way). Very clean rooms and hallways. I did not hear anyone on my floor. The only negative was that there was no view from my room, but I did not expect one for the price I paid. Ero molto contenta di soggiornare in un'albergo cosi carino ... davvero un gioello nel centro. Tornero' di sicuro.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendall92
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel I had a room which had a very bad bed and a smelly bathroom. However when I returned I was upgraded to a very nice room. The staff were very friendly to me and went out of their way to contact my tour company to ensure I was picked up on time. I was very impressed by their professional attitude. I was moved across to another hotel for one night but that Hotel was also a very high standard so I had no issue with the slight inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: aopa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, the property is in excellent condition and well maintained. We stayed 7 nights and had no issues. We were facing a main street and the well insulated windows kept the noise from the busy street very quiet. It was warm while we were there and used the a/c which worked well. The hotel is very clean and the pictures on the web are an accurate reflection of the actual property. The hotel was well staffed and everyone was attentive and consistently pleasant and helpful. Our room was of adequate size, but as to be expected, it was very small by American standards. The housekeeping staff cleaned the room twice daily, fresh sheets and towels each time. I would highly recommend this property and I feel that the price was in line for the quality of hotel. To get online we used the computer at the property, if you plan to do so, you should know that there is only one station and it was frequently occupied. Breakfast buffet was very good and well maintained. The hotel is very close to a metro stop, but if you are looking to walk everywhere, you might want to closely evaluate the location to ensure that you have a good understanding of the distance to sites. We found the resturants in the area to be very good; however, they were a bit more expensive than in other areas where we ate.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby.”
Reviews.Author: Vecuronium823
Reviews.Content: The room was quite small, as should be expected. The decor was decent, no frills. The bathroom was clean. However, there was a mildew stench in our room, which went away...after a day and a half. All in all, the room served its purpose and expect nothing more. Decent location. Steps from the Palazzo Barberini. Walking distance to the Foutain of Trevi. Conveniently close to one of the "Rome Open Tour Bus" stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: m0ls0n
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel. Everyone was friendly, service was great, room was large for Europe, you know what I mean. Clean, and well appointed. Breakfast was good. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a wonderful experience in a hotel. The tv could have a few more english speaking stations, but that is all I could say that was negative. Having said that your in Rome, get out and watch tv when you get home! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely escape with friendly and professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: lcshaible
Reviews.Content: Excellent assistance and very gracious staff. Concierge, Lucio, was excellent. Evening lounge attendant during our stay 8/11-13/10 was gracious and offered wonderful tour information. Porter during our stay was also friendly and so helpful. Rooms (stayed twice in two weeks) were lovely. Would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but the staff has a big heart”
Reviews.Author: LovesTraveling_10
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room I had was quite small, but the staff was so hospitable it more than made up for the size. They went out of their way to provide glutin free items for breakfast, as well as to recommend places to shop for specific items. From Fabrizio to Marco, Massimo, Lucio and funny funny Paolo, I could not have been better placed. What good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel small and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Libi4
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd time at the hotel. Great location,very clean hotel. The room was again nicely decorated and well kept Staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: xclusiveDubai
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, once an office spot, is bang in the center of every major attraction in Rome. The breakfast is not that great as it is very basic if you must know. Rooms are small but very comfortable, free wired internet is available in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: marfedlstein
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel from the accomodating staff, to the room appointments, to the delicious breakfast. Would definately recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice, good staff ...room a little bit small”
Reviews.Author: teresabattista
Reviews.Content: it is a good 4 stars hotel, even if it is in the middle of roads and traffic rooms are very good isolated. good and polite staff, perhaps rooms are a little bit too small for my needs. but anyway a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not the second time to be there”
Reviews.Author: adesigna
Reviews.Content: I was hoping for a cozy romantic atmosphere close to Spanish steps. Room we got had the only positive thing about it - a very big window. However it was looking at a lively street so in the mornings it was rather noisy. It was not as close to the Spanish steps as I expected (however it is just my one mistake). The breakfast was awful plenty of the waiters but no drinks as free perusal - for even a glass of water you needed to ask for (several times!). As to the contents of the breakfast - to break the fast it would suffice but it was definitely too scarce. Bathroom - awfull again - water not stable. To wash the head we needed to be very cautious - ice cold was changed to steam hot! If for whatever reason you stay there pay attention to the small place just accross the road - the guys have wonderful coffee and some really nice cakes and very italian sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cuteicecube
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel. The location is absolutely perfect - a couple of blocks away from the subway station and very easy access to several main bus lines. The staffs are really nice, the room and bathroom are very nice, modern and clean, and the breakfast is a very nice bonus (and they make great cappucino..yum!). The only (somewhat) downside is you can hear some of the traffic noises since the hotel is right on a busy road, but it's really not bad at all..it didn't really disturb my sleep. Plus, it's nice to be out early and have plenty of time to take in the sights of Rome anyway :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: nancydancer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Stendhal was wonderful - we loved everything about it. The location was perfect, the rooms well appointed and clean, the staff very friendly and helpful and the hotel beautiful. The breakfast was an added bonus - with great coffee drinks (any way you want one). We would definitely go back. Rome is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: g0ing2places
Reviews.Content: This is our third time we stayed at this hotel and the reasons that we have come back again is the staff at the hotel, from the moment you walk in the front door after a long flight from Australia we are greeted as old friends. All the staff are willing to do what it takes to make your stay memorable and everything is taken care of. Service is excellent. My wife wont stay anywhere else it is close to everything including the best shopping in Rome and she doesn't need to carry her bags too far back to the hotel. The hotel may be described as small but it is a boutique hotel so don't expect the Sheraton because it is nothing like that. But if you want a nice intimate hotel that is comfortable has great service, is clean and when you step outside the front doors everything is at your fingertips this is the place to stay. We are going back again this year for our fourth stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed with Stendhal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abrannigan
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 star hotel for a romantic trip. Location was fine but hotel was very small. Room sizes were disappointing even though we asked not to be put in a small room. We were told we were being offered a special rate of €159 per night even though they were selling online for €149. Continental breakfast was poor. Bread & pastries didnt seem fresh either morning, eggs were awful and juice was warm. Had a male porter walk into the room as he was knocking the door, as I was getting dressed and hotel maintenance meant drilling and banging very early in the morning which took them 1/2 hr to stop.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been great”
Reviews.Author: Fondofgoodtravel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents and their friends for a 3 night break in Rome between Christmas and New Year. I did extensive research to find somewhere comfortable and conveniently located for them. I wanted somewhere quiet and away from the hustle and bustle so they can relax after a hard day's sightseeing but close enough to the sights so that they could make the most of their short time there. I was so keen for this trip to be perfect for them. I booked tours and even hand typed a detailed guide for them to use with maps and instructions on how to get to places. They don't get away often and their friends were visiting from Hong Kong so I really wanted this to go well. I emailed the hotel a few weeks in advance to confirm the stay. Unfortunately my parents and their friends did not get to experience the beauty, tranquillity, excellent service and location of the hotel in spite of all my hard work in trying to find them the best hotel. The hotel had over booked so they were sent to a hote further away. I understand that overbooking is a common practice with hotels but it is not one that is customer focused. So all my research effectively went out the window. The hotel that my parents were offered as an alternative was a 15 minute walk away and further away from the central area. It was also up a slope with was difficult for my mum who has mobility issues. In fairness to the Stendhal Hotel, they were polite and courteous about the situation. The hotel they offered was of a similar standard. They offered my parents a free upgrade should they stay there again. Arguably they did what they had to do plus a little bit more by offering the free upgrade according to terms and conditions. However I can't help but feel disappointed that this happened and want to inform others that this is probably a great hotel (I don't doubt the reviews etc) if you get to stay there. Please be aware that this hotel does overbook its rooms so even if you book with them and email to confirm there is a chance you may not get to stay there. Finally, I can't help but feel that what's the point of the free upgrade as knowing my luck, if we re booked to stay there chances are we'd get shunted off somewhere else so wouldn't be able to experience the upgrade anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: HoorooImOff
Reviews.Content: Quiet despite being on the first floor above a very busy street. Our first experience of booking over the internet couldn't be in better hands. Everything from arranging a driver to collect us from the port to advising on Rome tours were handled promptly and efficiently. Rooms were comfortable, clean and adequate. Service at inclusive breakfast 1st class. It was an oasis in the middle of Romes summer heat! Close to tour bus circuit and within easy walking distant (before it became too hot - we came out of the Australian winter!!) to shops etc. We have recommended the Stendhal to our travel agent as prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: hevyr
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching hotels before the trip and I have to say we were both really pleased that we chose the Stendhal. It is a small but very comfortable hotel. It looks just like the photos on the website. The rooms are small, but well decorated. The location is excellent, we could walk everywhere. The metro stops just at the end of the street so we used this to get to and from the main station and vatican. The staff are helpful, but discreet and not overpowering. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, really glad we found it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for trip w/ teens. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: LacrosseMD
Reviews.Content: Small boutique type hotel. GREAT location across from a great gelatti place called White, the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain (which in a city of a million works of art was very impressive). Found it through Costco.com's travel service. Clean rooms, not big, but we didn't spend much time there. Good breakfast, very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: JJD2
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased overall with out experience at Hotel Stendahl. We only took off a point because we did spend a few hours in the lobby waiting for our toilet to be repaired, which was a bit of an inconvenience. In hindsite, we should have notified the front desk after we had finished with our morning routine, rather than before. Otherwise, we had no complaints, and we would definitely recommend this hotel for the convenient location (close to Spanish Steps, Metro, Trevi Fountain), spotless rooms, and friendly staff. We took advantage of the 40% off promotion for the month of August - not a bad deal at all! We would definitely stay again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - recommended”
Reviews.Author: wang923
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Shendhal Hotel. The staff was very helpful as they helped get us dinner reservations on multiple occasions. Room was small but was fine for our needs. Internet was free in the lobby - great for checking email during breakfast. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Solid option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EricN99
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Rome are overpriced and I never feel like we're getting great value. I've been there three times, and this is the best we've done yet. Location is extremely convenient to walk to sites; everything is within 15 minutes. Air conditioning works. Buffet breakfast is excellent. Service was efficient, and the rooms are quiet. Bathrooms are also sizable and modern, which matters a lot to us. The only negative I'd say is that the mattresses and pillows are not great. They're fine, just not as nice as other things in the hotel. It's hard to find a perfect hotel in Rome, so don't even try. But if you can get a decent price at Stendhal, you'll certainly be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location... expedia bookers beware”
Reviews.Author: lizzy2005
Reviews.Content: We booked a five night stay in Rome at the Stendhal due to the outstanding reviews it had received on trip advisor. We were not disappointed the hotel lived up to its excellent reviews. The staff was extremely helpful and the breakfast was very good... the cappuccinos were the best in Rome. Our only glitch came upon arrival when the hotel claimed that our room had been given away and that the hotel was booked for the night. As a result we were re-booked for the first night in a sister hotel Mascagni which is a far cry from the Stendhal. After discussing the situation with the manager it became apparent that we were moved -- rather than the person that received our room--based on our "contract" which was likely due to our low rate with Expedia. The manager comped us a bottle of spumanti to make up for the hotel switch when we finally checked into the Stendhal.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, very clean and comfortable with great air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: wenyar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The staff are professional, friendly and helpful. The air conditioning in our room was fantastic and very welcome after a day in the sun. Breakfast was lovely with a good choice and in a relaxing environment. The staff were very attentive. Tip - try trattorias in the Trastevere area across the river - easy to get to by bus, taxi or even on foot. Restaurants near the hotel are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Wonderful, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: lwhitmandc
Reviews.Content: We cannot get over how nice the staff was. The desk attendant, the bartender, the maid, the porters and breakfast attendants. Down to the last person. They were warm, welcoming and helpful. The hotel itself was quite modern, with beautiful decor. We went for the upgraded room, for a little extra space. However, most of that space was devoted to a hallway entering the room, which didn't add any floor space ... so the room was a bit tight for two people. The room faced the main street, but it was perfectly quiet. We would certainly stay at this hotel again, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Helped make our stay so enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Ron74
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a terrific find for us. The location is absolutely perfect, right at the base of the Via Veneto. The staff was probably one of the best I have ever dealt with at any hotel. It is very small, yet the staff was so attentavie and helpful that it truly made a difference in our trip. The room was fairly small, but since we asked for a room in the back it was very quiet. all the amenities were perfect and it was really a pleasure to come back to after a long day of walking and sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel with beautiful appointments, great staff, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: LALAtravelbug
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stendhal in Rome, Italy was a lovely surprise! My brother stayed there in March 2005 and highly recommended it, mainly because of the location. We wanted a quiet room, which means NOT on the street and no view, but a good night's sleep was our #1 requirement. The staff was extremely professional, and because we stayed 7 nights, we got to know everyone a bit better. They were terrific with suggestions, particularly Luceo, who knew every amazing small church that we would have missed otherwise. He's into architecture and loves giving historical information about Rome. Fabrizio, manager?, is the man you need to know for reservations. He really takes note of your personal needs/requests and makes it happen. There are 2 Andreas, each very knowledgeable about different parts of the city. They were always interested in OUR opinion of a particular restaurant. Breakfast was a real treat - 5 star - in a beautiful, cozy dining room or library, which turned into the bar in the evening. The hotel is SMALL, but extremely well designed. Compact, yet room for everything. Smart closets, beautiful baths. None of the interior photos on the website do the bathrooms justice. If there is a problem, someone is there within two minutes - truly!! (If you are a tall or large person, this place is not for you! And we only saw one child. Some teenagers, but mostly couples or business people.) The location was very central for all that we wanted, for a first trip to Rome. Close to Via Veneto, Spanish Steps, luxury shopping near Via Condotti, tourbus stops one block away. We walked mostly, because many sights are closer than you realize. The only cabs we were in were spotless, open and the drivers tended to speak enough English. You WILL get better treatment if you are polite and take the time to learn a few Italian phrases before you go, as you should going to ANY foreign country. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “no faults”
Reviews.Author: Keryn-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just a 2 min walk from the train station. Central to all the tourist sights, easy walking distance. Moderate sized room, spotless, quiet, friendly helpful staff. Free wifi in the lounge area. Breakfast included. Say no more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jowilling
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Rome as a solo traveler for a few days. I booked the Hotel Stendhal on the internet as my travel agent had mentioned it as a good hotel. The initial contact via internet was immediate and helpful with all my queries well answered. When I arrived in Rome I was greeted and shown to a great room overlooking the Via del Tritone. The room was spaciious with excellent facilities and light and the fittings first class. The staff were helpful with maps, directions and tour bookings. The hotel provided a full breakfast and had bar facilities but not a restaurant during the day or evening. This did not worry me as there were hundreds of places to eat nearby the hotel. The Piazza Barberini was a stone's throw away and all the star sights of Rome were within very easy walking distance - for example The Pantheon, The Trevi Fountain,The Spanish Steps, The Colesseum, The Roman Forum, Piazza Navona etc.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: shopperOntario
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the hotel Stendhal in Rome and would like to say that it was a joy to stay in a hotel with such class. The location was fabulous as we were within walking distance to the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and Colosseum. Our many thanks to Fabrizio and staff for making our visit so enjoyable! Mary

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: OSRS
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay in six monthes .Once more a very good hotel,great staff&service from reception to the chambermaid. Cozy Hotel an home away from home.very clean and spotless . Perfect location , 2-5 min from major landmarks such as spanish steps and fontana di Trevi. The rooms are small (after all an old building in the hart of Rome) but very well designed and decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for location,cleanliness and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NMAAustralia
Reviews.Content: Just a 2 night stay in this boutique gem found on Tripadvisor.The Hotel Stendhal was just as elegant as pictured on the website with a great traditional style decor,marble bathrooms with modern plumbing that worked,fluffly thick white towels and a room with all the inclusions that the traveller needs. The rooms may be a bit small, but then in a city like Rome you spend very little time in them. The fantastic location has one drawback in that that those rooms on the street front may be a bit noisy. The long shuttered windows plus the airconditioning means that some of the street noise can be overcome, but for me it was a case of" throw open the shutters", lean out over the French style balcony and marvel at the fountain at the end of the street and the passing parade of Romans....as they say "when in Rome"etc...! Included in the rate was a continental breakfast served in the tiny, classically furnished lounge-breakfast room. Nothing tiny about the breakfast though . It included eggs, pastries, fruit, cereal, cold meats and cheeses and the best coffee I had in Rome , ever so elegantly served in a sparkling silver pot and with hot frothy milk. Everything about the Hotel Stendhal sparkles. No dingey halls here, no clanking ,unreliable elevators.
