Everything shows the benefit of the modern renovation throughout and the whole is kept spotlessly clean by a team of housemaids wearing neat uniforms complete with fresh , starched white aprons. The staff in this hotel have a genuine warmth that shows in the level of guest service they give. Take the concierge, the wonderful Fabrizio, for example. He rang my cruise company and suggested, then organised , for them to pick me up for the transfer to the ship at a nearby hotel instead of at the airport. This not only saved me countless Euros for the taxi ride, but it allowed me to enjoy a relaxed and leisurely start to the day. Not only that, but when I went to check out Fabrizio would not let me leave until he had phoned to double check that the transfer courier was indeed waiting at the other hotel.What a man...what a gem! The little things count when you travel alone. This Hotel delivered on all counts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically central!”
Reviews.Author: hilandphil
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Lovely decor, rooms were small but very stylish and had everything we needed. We came for a birthday celebration, 4 couples minus kids and they were very nice to us and kept the prosecco flowing. There were families staying and they were very warm and friendly, I will return with mine.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of comfort”
Reviews.Author: fpanda
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, centrally located just minutes from the Spanish Steps (or drinks at the Hassler), steps from the Triton Fountain and stops for the city tour buses, walking distance to good restaurants and the Trevi Fountain as well as shopping on the Via Veneto or Via del Corso. The Breakfast buffet is convenient and the pastries delicious. And, the staff provides a comfortable bar to relax in before the next activity.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melbs_9
Reviews.Content: Our room was divine. Not huge, but beautifully decorated with very stylish decor and a very smart bathroom. The hotel is in a fantastic spot, a two minute walk to the spanish steps. The road where the hotel is situated is quite busy and noisy but the windows and shutters on the windows block out all the noise. The staff were great. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy and France and was served in a lovely, cosy area that made you feel like you were in a gorgeous home rather than a hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ShortTraveller
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Stendhal in Rome because of the location. The hotel is located about 2 blocks from the Barberini Metro Station. We received so much more than a convenient location. The staff was incredible. There was always a reception available, the bartender was fabulous and friendly, and the breakfast was wonderful. The rooms were a little small, but very quiet for the hotel being located on a busy street. The housekeeping staff was excellent. They cleaned our room twice a day and provided fresh clean towels and sheets. One night we requested a restaraunt recommendation. The receptionist took care of everything...he made our reservations for us at the time requested and asked the restaraunt to show us special attention. It was the most fabulous meal we had the entire vacation. I will return to Hotel Stendhal any time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLERGOWER
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that it was excellent, well appointed rooms, very clean, the stafff seem a happy bunch and the location was excellent too, breakfast was excellent, beautiful food, don't waste you time looking around for anywhere else to stay! Rome was awesome, will be going back at some point and will definately stay here again, it was expensive, but believe me well worth the money!! Try Pepys Coffe Shop/pizzeria opposite the hotel on the corner of piazza Bernini, for a great cup of coffee and a lovely spot to watch the world go by....

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: CharlottaP
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great, except the thin walls between the rooms! Great breakfast, service at the front desk was very good and location great. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Brava Brava Stendhal !!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTaylor212
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. Ideally located in Rome with an exemplary staff, from front desk to room service to housekeeping. Outstanding breakfast feast each morning awaited us. And the evening cocktails in the bar with Agostino Calabrese made the trip even better! Rooms aren't roomy, but who's gonna stay in their hotel room in Rome?!?!?! I'd stay here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: libi1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 nights stay just before the holydays 18-22/12/2008/ very nice hotel , great staff. Superb location: 3 min walk to spanish steps 2-3 min walk to trevi fountain 1 min from via veneto 10 min from piazza Navona The hotel in general and rooms are very clean .Nice rooms but small. Lovely breakfest area and food.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Dublin TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In Rome on business. Really disappointed with this hotel. I needed to cancel an extra night due to a change in a business meeting and, although, they didn't make me pay for it in the end, there was a big hoo-ha about whether they would let me off or not. The room was pretty awful. Tiny, single room, couped in, very little light and decor was oppressive - Victorian gone a bit mad with lots of patterned material wallpaper. Internet service was free but only one computer situated at the end of the breakfast room (with staff walking past all the time), access only 30 minutes and you had to get codes etc. from reception - disaster if you are trying to do some work. Will not be going back here. Amazed it features on some boutique websites - I guess it's because it's not too big. Only positive is location - Via del Tritone is pretty much in the centre of things. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JohnKIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Stendhal for four nights. Our room was on the first lfoor facing the busy via Trintone adjacent to Piazza Berberini. The room was very elegently decorated although a little small. Spacious marble bathroom. The Trevi Fountain was about 8 minutes walk from the hotel and the Spanish Steps not much further. Redline Berberini metro station was 2 minutes walk away in addition to a taxi rank. Breakfast was typically continental but very nice. Staff were extermely friendly and helpful. I would certainly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Recommendable, but not "Knock-Your-Socks-Off"”
Reviews.Author: oxman78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Stendhal September 4-7. This hotel was nice and a good value for the room rate. While it was not one of my favorite hotels of the several we stayed at as we traveled through Europe, it's definitely recommendable. What we liked: BATHROOM: The bathroom was very nicely appointed in marble with a fantastic shower. The shower head was the best we had in all of Europe (good pressure and it had an actual temperature gauge for the water...in Celsius if you can do the conversion in your head). ROOM SIZE: The room size was a bit bigger than average for Europe. Still smaller than most American hotels, but a good size for Europe. BREAKFAST ROOM: The breakfast room was comfortable and the service was satisfactory. The selection of food was good as well with eggs, fruits, meats and cheeses. I liked that each table in the room also had a basket of rolls and pastries. What could have been better: ELEVATOR: One can't complain too much about the size of elevators in Europe. For the most part they are a luxury to have in any building (which you'll find out as you take stairs through every museum in Europe) and when they are available they are almost with out exception small. My main complaint about the elevator is that it was, for lack of a better word, dodgy. Several times we would get on the elevator, we'd press the button to our floor, and...nothing happened. The door would open again and we'd press our floor a second time and it would finally do what it was supposed to do. VIA DEL TRITTONE: The street the hotel is on looks somewhat blighted. Now, we never felt unsafe in any part of Rome we visited, even late at night, it's just that the street looked a bit dirty and some of the buildings were in disrepair. Additionally, the street is fairly busy and while the windows and shutters keep it quiet and dark, there would be no possibility for keeping the windows open for fresh air. However, the location is pretty good overall. You're not far from the Spanish Steps and the Metro Barberini. ROOM CARPET: The carpet in the room could use at least a good deep cleaning if not complete replacement. It wasn't disgusting, but it had been worn and stained over time. OVERALL... We would recommend the hotel, however, whenever we go back to Rome, we'd like to stay closer to the Pantheon. The Pantheon area is a bit more central (and we just liked it more).

Reviews.Title: “Covenient location, overall good”
Reviews.Author: tradi_travel
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for walking to the major attractions, and one block to the subway station. Rooms very clean. Our 2nd floor room directly faced the very noisy / busy street, but soundproofing was excellent. Heard more noise from other guests milling in the hallway. This was the smallest of the rooms for our Italy trip. A few minor misses - Internet / business station was down all four days. We checked in ~ 6:30pm our first night. "...Your room should be ready soon, please have a seat in our lounge, it will just be a couple of minutes..." Seemed odd given our late arrival, but after ordering 2 mixed drinks for 20 Euros, I understood. Now our room was suddenly ready. Oh well, live and learn. Continental breakfast was good, if not crowded. One morning we came down and all the tables were filled with travelers hungrier than us. Oh well, get up a few minutes earlier the next day, and let someone else do the standing / waiting. Would probably try someplace else next trip to Rome, just for comparison purposes, but this hotel was fine overall.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zaria123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stendhal is really centrally located with just a few minutes walk to either the Trevi Fountain and to the Spanish Steps. We also walked to the Coliseum within about 15 minutes etc. Also the Metro stop is 1 minutes walk away at Piazza De Barberini, which we used to travel the further distance to the Vatican for the day. Buy a daily ticket for the Metro, really good idea for hopping on and off. Hotel Stendhal, we really friendly and helpful when booking by email, and we had a beautiful roof top Executive Room with its own private roof terrace, surrounded by plants, table, chairs and parasol. The Hotel is immaculately clean, and although the rooms aren't huge they are certainly large enough. We were also treated to a bottle of sparkly wine delivered to our room when we checked in which was really nice. Another nice touch was little cards delivered when the beds were being turned down giving info on the next days weather. The style of the room was really nice, and featured fabric covered walls, and heavy drapes, as well as shutters on the windows. The quality of the fixtures and fittings was excellent too. Breakfast was nice, and the usual american / continental fayre of cereals, breads, fruits, juices, pastries etc. The waiting staff speak good English and were totally pleasant, and cheerful. The same could be said for the Bar Man, Porter and Reception Staff. We also used the Hotels Private Mercedes car to be collected at the Airport, which only worked out at 20 Euro more than a standard taxi. The car was once again immaculate, and the driver friendly, and talked us through some of the sights of Rome as we drove to the Hotel. There were only two small (and very minor) issues. The internet available was either terribly slow, or else it wasn't working correctly. After 25 minutes of waiting for google and trenitalia website to download we gave up (we even tried wifi but just the same). Wasn't too much of a problem, as we used our guide book to find an internet cafe, and hopped on the Metro using our day pass. The other very minor issue was the safe in the room was functional. Everything else was totally spot on. We would definately use the Hotel again. Things to try: Walk to Giolittis Ice Cream Shop - Via degli Uffici del Vicario, 40, aparently favoured by Pope John Paul II, it was wonderful and far superior to the average ice cream in the other shops. Its worth the 10 minute walk!!!! Sit in or take away, the staff wore white jackets, emblazened with gold braid epelettes. Really nice atmosphere in the evenings around the City and it felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: citypog
Reviews.Content: Chose the Stendhal after looking at many different 4 star hotels in the centre of Rome. This hotel was absolutely fantastic! A great central location not far from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. Beautifully decorated, tradtional but with a contemporary twist. Rooms are small but lovely and well sound proofed. We had a room at the back, view not great but very quiet as no traffic!! Breakfast was brilliant, something for everyone, continental style. The staff were exemplary, so helpful, friendly and very professional. We would definately recommend this hotel and will stay here again when we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stendhal Rome”
Reviews.Author: mezzeta
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, Great staff, The rooms were a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a hotel which actually looks like on its website!”
Reviews.Author: scoutNY
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Rome and while there stayed at the Hotel Stendhal. Finally a hotel, which looks exactly like on their website! Even though our room, we booked the double standard, was the tiniest room we have ever stayed in - and we travel frequently to Manhattan - it was very well done! We had room 625 on the top floor towards the back and therefore no street noise at all. We actually slept with the window slightly open. The bathroom was nearly the size of the room and was done very nice and seemed brandnew. A heated towel rack was a nice extra. Breakfast served downstairs in the bar / reading room area was excellent and plentiful served by uniformed waiters and the hot beverages came in typically grand hotel silver. The buffet had scrambled eggs, cheese, salami and ham as well as different kind of cereal and fresh fruit. The breadbasket contained rolls, croissants and danishes and you were also able to order fresh juices. The only negative was, that the free computer in the reading room either did not work at all or was painfully slow. So don't count on checking emails, but enjoy Rome instaed. Location is great and we took the Leonardo Express from FCO A/P to the Termini station and than connected to the subway for 2 more stops. The subway is about 2 min. from the hotel. All in all we had a great stay and would definitely recommand this hotel to our friends

Reviews.Title: “The Stendhal was a perfect choice for us!”
Reviews.Author: zacharyNewYork
Reviews.Content: We chose to celebrate our 30th anniversary with a trip to Italy and Rome was our first stop. The Stendhal really was the perfect hotel for us. We were quite fortunate to be upgraded to a very spacious and well appointed room, 601, which also had a roof top terrace where we were able to have a lovely breakfast. This boutique hotel is beautifully decorated and maintained. We enjoyed breakfast in the morning and drinks in the evening in the very cozy sitting rooms. As others have said, the location is wonderful and there are many fine restaurants within the immediate vicinity of the hotel. The concierges were all helpful even before our arrival--Fabrizio helped me via email with my many questions in the weeks prior to the trip. Andrea arranged for our various tours and made some excellent restaurant suggestions. Our visit was off season so I feel, considering how weak the dollar is, we got great value for our money. I would not hesitate to recommend the Stendhal and look forward to returning one day!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: caesarPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week. Based on previous reviews, we decided to upgrade to a superior room. This was a good idea, because the standard rooms are small, whereas the superior room was a perfect size, and tastefully done. I can't say enough good things about the hotel. Great service, private, nicely decorated, helpful staff (they helped with reservations, and sent us to a few really good restaurants. if you're nice, the bartender will even perform magic tricks!), perfect location, nice breakfast. We plan on returning, and would not even think of another place to stay. Having stayed at many nice hotels around the world, this is absolutely one of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “A downright joke”
Reviews.Author: WerthersLeicester
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the hotel Stendhal in Rome with my wife just a few weeks ago and we were sorely disappointed by the service we received for the price we paid. The staff have no concept of good service or care, and small wonder if they take their orders from the manager, who seemingly has no idea about hospitality and every idea how to make money. When we arrived we were greeted as if we were backpackers checking into a hostel, our passports were taken from us before we were even afforded a hello. The room, a standard double, was average for a three-star (this was advertised as a four star) and the place is grossly overpriced. The only good thing about this is the location. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: KandS027
Reviews.Content: Just returned and felt I needed to write a review to let you all know that this hotel is great. Stayed in room 504. Don't expect a view as its at the rear of the hotel but there was a balcony we could step out on. Being at the back made sure we had a great nights sleep, bed was a great size. Room and Service were immaculate,couldn't have asked for more. Our bags were taken to our room and our bed was turned down on one of the nights. Staff were very pleasant and helped with any request we needed. Hotel was very secure and my husband and I felt safe there. Brilliant location, a few minutes walk to both the Trevi and Spanish Steps and just south of Via Veneto. Very close to the metro which was easy to use to and from the Airport (Fiumincino). Would recommend to everyone. Loved it and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stendhal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaddness
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent. It is walking distance to the Spanish Steps and the subway was only a short walk away. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Try out the Snack Bar, a coffee shop near the hotel. They have excellent coffee and pastries. We had a fabulous time! I would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lighttraveller1
Reviews.Content: This my second visit to Rome and my second stay at the Hotel Stendhal. Without a doubt this would have to be one of the finest boutique hotels anywhwere in the world. The rooms and hotel are impeccably clean, the standard of amenties are first class and the rooms are just gorgeous. If you can when booking, try to order room 202 or 201 (this room has a balcony). The only issue I do have is that the staff don't speak English very well, but they do try very hard and will attend to all your needs. Again a great hotel, but a hotel is only as good as their staff, and I think there staff do try very hard to make their guests welcome and relaxed. The location of this hotel is ideal if you want to see the sights or there is a need to go shopping. You are literally 200 meters from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Best Around by a long shot”
Reviews.Author: Herewego97
Reviews.Content: We wanted a small tidy hotel in the Rome city centre within walking distance of most attractions and this hotel was perfect for our 10th wedding anniversary. It may look small but that is the only thing, it is big in everything else. Cleanliness, attention, service, staff, location,bar, price it was well above avarage on all of these even bordering on excellent. Don't expect a british style hotel cooked breakfast you won't get it, the Italians don't eat like that but what you do get is more than enough to get you going for the day, the coffee was excellent. Our room was at the back of the hotel as requested, so I didn't expcet to see much, that is what we done the rest of the day. The round Rome tour bus stop was 2 minutes walk from the hotel, cafes and restraunts are eveywhere. Don't get ripped of in a taxi, met a couple from Ireland and they paid 120 euro from the airport, this is between 40 and 60 normally. My helpful hint would be to get a phrase book and learn how or at least try ask for things in Italian, most can talk english but after all we are in Rome, you will find the locals tend to be more helpful when you try.

Reviews.Title: “Location is about it”
Reviews.Author: smartiq
Reviews.Content: Well the location was top for shopping at the Spanish Steps- Via COndotti or on Via del Corso, and also near the many attractions and it was also easy to find a cab being right on the Piazza Barberini. However the room was attrociously small for two women who liked to shop. They did switch us to another room but it was not much better. There were no robes or slippers in either room until I requested them by tipping the maid. The internet was not working for the two days when we were there, and although bar and lounge staff was very nice and friendly, front desk was cold and not nice as if they were working the front desk of an Ibis. Any request seemed to be a hassle for them, giving directions, pointing us out to an internet cafe, arranging transport to the outlets, etc. Not 4* rooms or service. Breakfast was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointed....Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: lavender3
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here after looking at some very good reviews on TA. When we arrived we asked for a nice room as it was our Honeymoon, the man was quiet rude and simply said "it is a nice room" When we went to the room we were impressed with the decor and the size was o.k. however when we opened the shutters we were looking out onto another buliding which made the room very dull, when we asked for a room facing onto the street the receptionist told us the hotel was full, when I said that I was'nt happy with the room he then agreed to offer us another room. The room facing onto the street was tiny, barley any room to walk by the end of the bed. The location however is good and within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Spannish Steps, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The reception staff were quiet rude and found them to be un helpfull, The bar was tiny and in the morning it was the breakfast buffett, very poor selection and 2 of the 3 mornings we were there I asked for coffee which I did not receive. The only daving grace is the Location, other than that I would not reccomend. Rome however is a suberb city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: marixaki
Reviews.Content: I spent one night, thankfully, at the hotel Stendhal and was very disappointed. I found this hotel on the internet and it looked a charming hotel however although the hotel is centrally located, clean and nicely decorated it is certainly not worth the EURO 310 per night that they charged for a standard double room. The room was extremely small (you could just about walk around the bed in the room) with a window facing a wall in the back where you could hear the fans of the air conditioning, the staff in the Kitchen taking their break and see the laundry of the neighbors handing approx one meter from the window. Room to avoid 105 and all rear rooms, which I presume have the same unfortunate view.

Reviews.Title: “Stendhal Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BearsFanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Rome. Booked Stendhal through Costco Travel. Regardless of what you read elsewhere, this is a great hotel. The only problem we had was with the safe in the room. Staff tried repeatedly but could not repair it. Excellent full breakfast. Very helpful staff. Our stay came during a bad heat wave, but the AC worked great (unlike others I heard about in Rome). Room was absolutely silent with good sound proofing. Good location several blocks from Trevi Fountain. Great local restaurants too. Would stay there again if I get to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jerseydan
Reviews.Content: On arriving, we were told we would have to wait half hour to check in but aw we arrived at 12.30pm, well before the stated check-in time of 2, this was fine with us. After returning from a short walk in the neighbourhood, we we let into our room, and found a compact, yet delightful room, tastefully decorated in a fresh and modern style. Not much room for our luggage - i just heaved it on top of the wardrobes - all in all not a huge amount of storage or layout space, but this is to be expected and shouldn't be a problem unless you intend to stay for more than a week. Our stay lasted three nights, and in all we found the hotel to be clean, and the staff friendly and attentive. I noticed a few comments in other reviews about dirty carpets, i suppose a few marks here and there, but i don't know what you expect with light coloured carpets and a city where it gets so hot in summer you leave footprints in the tarmac. Wear the complimentary slippers if it bothers you that much. Staff presence was a bit lacking between midnight and 6am so if you need any towels etc make sure you ask before you head out at night. Breakfast was lacking in variety, but after all the gelato and pasta from the night before, probably not a bad thing, and you can ask for pastries of your choice with delicious coffee. Hotel location is perfect - just far away enough out of the bustle - yet easy walking distance from Trevi, Spansih steps and shopping. Aircon worked just fine and traffic noise dampned just enough by shutters to ensure good nights sleep. Couldn't have asked for anymore considering what we paid - value wise compares very favourable to other city breaks we've done - Stendhal definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: GiGiSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stendhal twice (at the beginning and end) of our trip to Italy. We found the location to be excellent - easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Condotti, Pantheon, Piazza Navaronne etc, and only 25 minutes walk to the Vatican and about the same to the Coliseum. We arrived at the Stendhal early on our first day in Rome (at 7.30 am after a 12 hour flight), well before check-in. The front desk advised us to go for a walk and have breakfast and to come back around 9.00 am to see if a room was available. When we got back to the hotel we were shown straight to our room, the bags were already there. Our room (401) was on the 4th floor at the front of the hotel, it had a small balcony looking over via del Tritone. Yes, it is a busy street and you might find it noisy if you kept the french doors (double glazed) open but when they and the shutters were closed the street noise was minimal. It was hot in Rome and the air-conditioning worked well so we didn't have any problems sleeping. The room was not large but tastefully decorated and contained everything we needed. The bathroom isn't huge either but is well laid out. Both the room and the bathroom were spotlessly clean. One day they were a little late servicing our room but that wasn't a big deal, we just asked for fresh towels so we could shower before heading out again. The public areas of the hotel were also very pleasant and well maintained. We found the front desk/concierge staff to be generally extremely helpful and pleasant (we encountered one slightly grumpy guy once). The free internet computer is connected to a printer so you can check-in online and print boarding passes etc. The service in the breakfast area/bar was good and the buffet breakfast was fresh and offered a reasonable choice for a small establishment. We enjoyed drinks in the bar on a couple of evenings, the bellinis made with fresh peach juice are scrumptious. On our way back through Rome we were happy to return to the Stendhal and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: PennValley
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 12 night stay at the Stendhal, Roma. Things could not have been better! The entire staff, including desk managers Suraj and Fabrizio were benissimo! Hotel was kept extremely clean. We were impressed with how thorough the "common areas" were always spotless. I cannot speak for all the rooms, but ours was perfect (#601). We were on the top floor with a large patio/deck. We had A/C, so windows could be closed at night, and it was quietly secure from street noise. A very nice breakfast is included. Again, the staff is very friendly and helpful. Of course, the location is probably the best feature of this hotel. Very centrally located, we could walk to nearly every site in the city. We booked the hotel, airport ground transportation, and five city-tours using COSTCO Travel services. I would recommend using the hotel service to book mini-tours. The ground transportation to and from the airport is also highly recommended. Thank you, Stendhal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: adent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great spot, in the heart of Rome. Transportation to most sites are walking distance. The one complaint would be that the hotel apparantly over booked and we were bumped off the list and they had to put us up in another hotel. Even though they were kind enough to cover the cost of taxi, night stay, it still messed up our itinerary because we couldn't really settle in and weren't allowed to check in until late the next day. Other than that, I would recommend this hotel, might just want to call the day before and make sure they still have you in their reservations..

Reviews.Title: “Stendhal - a good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Camarche
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel, great location, rooms & staff (pity about Rome in general) NIce start to the day with a typical "european breakfast". Also the bar/breakfast room is nice spot for a nightcap. Rooms are very comfortable,not large but made up for this with all the little details you'd expect from a hotel with a higher rating. DINING TIP: For the ultimate in fine dining, I have to say "La Pergola" at the Hilton Cavlierie exceeded my highest hopes - ultimate perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Could be a nice hotel were it not for the unscrupulous staff!!”
Reviews.Author: JC78
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for 3 nights in December 2006 to coincide with my birthday. I booked the room directly through the hotel website a good month before we were due to arrive and upgraded to a superior room. An early flight meant we were due to arrive in Rome shortly before midday on the saturday, therefore I contacted the hotel earlier in the week to request if a slightly earlier check in would be possible, to which i received a prompt response assuring me that would be fine. Upon arriving at the hotel at noon our room was not ready and we were told to come back in two hours. I did point out to the man at the front desk that I had received confirmation that we could check in at 12 but he said they could not guarantee this (despite the email assuring me otherwise!). Anyway, upon returning 2 hours later we were shown to a room which although nice, was tiny and not (according to the pictures on the hotel website) the superior room I had booked. To add insult to injury, the paperwork we had been given at check detailed charges relating to a superior room and not the standard room we had been allocated. When we queried this with the same member of staff he simply said that there wasn't a superior room vacant but he would try and get us a transfer the next day. At no point did he apologise and in fact his manner was extremely arrogant and rude throughout our dealings with him. When I challenged him about being charged the higher price he said he would give us a (very measly!)reduction for the first night but we would be charged the superior rate once we transferred room the next day. The following day we were allocated a different room but this meant we had to leave our bags at breakfast time and they would be moved to a different room while we out. This meant that we couldn't really unpack our first night and to some extent the afternoon and evening were tainted by our annoyance at feeling like we were being taken for a ride by the hotel. What irked me most was that had we not stood our ground, we would have been charged the higher rate for a standard room for the duration of the stay. A dirty trick to play when the hotel charges in excess of a hundred pounds a night. In conclusion, whilst the rest of our stay was pleasant enough I'm afraid the apparently blatant attempts to rip us off left a bad taste in our mouth which would not inspire me to recommend this hotel to anyone or book it again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Porthos80
Reviews.Content: if you value your sleep. Firstly, as mentioned by previous reviewers the hotel is not as close to the Trevi Fountain as indicated in advertising. But the biggest problem with this hotel is its' proximity to a very busy street. Our room faced the outside of the hotel and we were kept awake throught the whole night by traffic. I honestly have never had a worse nights sleep in a hotel. Also, pictures accompanying ads for this hotel really do not show how small the rooms are and how DIRTY the carpet is in the rooms. Ours was a disgrace and I saw others around us being cleaned which were the same. Only we had arrived late from Florence we would have gone to another hotel but as we had only one night in the hotel we put up with it. What looks like wallpaper in pictures is actually fabric on the walls, so if you have asthma you're screwed in this hotel. The bed linen also needed to be replaced and I swear there were pubic hairs in the bath although my husband disagrees with me. The hotel staff were friendly enough but the Manager had a serious attitude problem. He was shouting at a member of staff when we checked in! Oh and the piece de resistance.... the hotels homepage on the Mac in the lounge is Tripadvisor.com so you can guarantee that they are creating bogus reviews here. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Manager, Great Service, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Deep
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling to Rome, i'd recommend you stay at Hotel Stendahl It's a 4-star hotel with great service. Ask for their manager "Suraj Balajee". We found ourselves in a pickle at a hotel across the street from Stendahl. We literally walked-in and Mr. Balajee ensured that our stay would be comfortable. Their morning breakfast is great and everyone there is absolutely great on service and in making your stay comfortable. Beds were turned everytime we left the room. Location is close to the Metro stop (2nd stop on the Blue line from Termini). 5 minute was to the Trevi Fountains. Nice 25 minute stroll to the Colesium area Thanks Mr. Balajee for making our stay comfortable

Reviews.Title: “True Essence of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rosalie-Italy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy that included a 2 day stay at the Stendhal Hotel in Rome. When you walk in the front door to the lobby you can feel the class and elegance of Rome. From the moment we arrived we were treated to the hospitality of the staff that did everything to make sure we were happy. They were so friendly and so nice. They made sure that every need was met. The room were luxurious and large. We had a king size bed that was so comfortable it was hard to get up. We were treated to robes and slippers and a complimentary fruit basket. We were also treated to a complimentary breakfast buffet every morning with fresh coffees of your choice. The hotel is located on a busy street, close to everything you need. It was within walking distance of many fine businesses inlcuding restaurants. We enjoyed it so much that the next time we are fortunate enough to travel to Rome, we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading map indication for Stendhal (hotel website + Venere.com)”
Reviews.Author: misuta
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from its location in their website which is completely misleading, as is the site of Venere.com. In fact the hotel is on the corner of Via del Tritone and via Sistina, just off the busy Piazza Barberini, in front of a traffic light in a 3-lane, extremely busy road. So it's very noisy in front. We checked the rooms in the rear, but they are affected by cooking smells from a restaurant below. Otherwise, the staff are friendly, and the rooms small but comfortable. The key descriptives must therefore be "very noisy" and "rather polluted" because of the dense traffic flowing past all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loacation..1week stay Oct. 19th”
Reviews.Author: jcmg
Reviews.Content: We just cam back from a one week stay at the Stendhal. This was our sixth trip to Rome and we normally stay at the Intercontinental, but the price in High season finally forced us to change. So after hours of searching I booked the Stendhal. We arrived early a.m. around 10 and were given our rooms by noon, which I thought was great. Man at the desk was very friendly. Here are my thoughts. Pro's... Perfect location for walking around Rome Spotlessly clean common areas and rooms the fastest roomservice I have ever experienced The front desk aside the staff was as friendly and helpful as I have ever experienced. Good value for the location and time of year Con's Trying to get suggestions for Dinner seemed a little like pulling teeth. I was given one suggestion Mario's (which was great) the entire week, the rest were all my idea. When we were not able to get into one of my choices they seemed incapable of any other options. One night I was told 40 min. before my supposed reservation that we couldnt get in, "sorry" click The rooms looked exactly as they do on the website but.... were a bit smaller than I thought they would be, and we didnt have enough closet space for 2 people for the week which made the room even more crowded. We also never saw the slippers and robes nor did we get the promised night time turn down unless you asked. Which they did gladly. All in all I was pleased with my stay. I wouldnt hesitate to refer the hotel as long as you have some knowledge of the city. The area makes this a 4 star, the rest I'm not sure I could agree makes this a 4star. If you have any questions I would be happy to answer them.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location (and champagne)”
Reviews.Author: SanMateoMee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Stendhal in October for our 20th wedding anniversary. You can't ask for a better location. We walked everywhere, and the few times we needed a metro we used the stop just steps from the Hotel's front door. It was a cheap taxi fare to the train station, which I wish we'd known on the way there so we could have avoided lugging heavy suitcases up those metro stairs! We had a room with a private balcony which we put to good use each evening for a cocktail before we headed out for dinner. Once the french doors were closed it was quiet as can be in the room, which was surprising given how busy the street was. The staff surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne delivered to our room one evening for our anniversary, which was a very nice touch. The room was smallish, but well appointed and comfortable. It was a little more pricey than we usually spend, but worth it. The hotel computer's internet access wasn't working and the people at the front desk didn't have great restaurant recommendations, but those were minor flaws in an otherwise quite pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good choice - stay here”
Reviews.Author: Havefuneatwell
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Stendhal in September. It is a modern, very clean hotel located on via del Tritone, a very short walk from the Barberini metro stop. It is also a short walk from the Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps. The reception staff is polite but could be a little warmer. They didn't seem too knowledgeable about local restaurants, but were very helpful in arranging tours and giving directions to the tourist sites. We had a very nice suite, complete with our own private terrace with its own table and even 2 lime trees. Although the room was small by US standards, it was modern and nicely decorated. The bathroom was a decent size, with marble floors and walls. The breakfast was very good, with eggs, pastries, croissants, etc. The best meal we had nearby was at Ciao Bella, left out of the hotel then left again on via Veneto, then left into a small alley. It has the same menu as the more touristy restaurant on via Veneto but a competely different ambiance. We thought Tullios was way overpriced for what you got. Overall, we would certainly stay here again. A good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: sd_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: Great location to walk the Roman sites. Good breakfast. Room was modern, comfortable, clean, nice sized bathroom. Even street facing room was quiet with double paned window. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a Treasure”
Reviews.Author: toobusyvol
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a wonderful surprise. The location is great, but the staff, size of the rooms, decor, breakfast setting, etc. was the best. Our room faced the street, yet was extremely quiet. Even with the 98 degree temperature outside (we were there late July), the room was cool enough. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: aroberts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon in Italy. We stayed at the Hotel Stendahl for the last 3 nights of our stay. We were not impressed at all. First, the people that work there are not friendly or helpful at all. The breakfast they offered was not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel, basically they offered canned fruit, packaged ham/cheese and a lot of starchy pastries. Also for a 4 star hotel we didn't receive many of the extras you typically get, such as slippers, bathrobes etc. In addition there was no where to go in the hotel except for your room - they say they have a bar but it is hardly what I would call a hotel bar and we never saw a soul in there the 3 nights we were there. I would not recommend this hotel. The service, view, amenities, feel of this hotel is more in line with an inexpensive bed and breakfast than a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: AKANTI
Reviews.Content: Moved into the Stendhal Hotel with a friend, after staying in an apartment in the Piazza Novona area. Much preferred the Piazza Novona area, however even though the Hotel is situated on a busy street, the windows were soundproof. The bedrooms were small but clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The internet facility didn't work very well and the actual communal space of the Hotel was small but in general a convenient place to stay while visiting Rome. What an amazing City - a must!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed two days here. Is well located at the Piazza Barberini end of the Via del Tritone. Easy walk to Trevi and Spanish Steps. Clean rooms and friendly staff although not overwhelmed by the breakfast. Would recommend the Tullio trattoria just off Barberini.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel!
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel May 2-May 8th. The hotel is on a very busy street but is so ideally located it is perfect. We walked everywhere. The hotel is very nicely decorated and feels welcoming and comfortable as soon as you enter. We arrived a few hours before check-in but we only had to wait about 15 minutes for our room. We were in a room overlooking the busy street below but we enjoyed the view and with the windows closed we had no problem with noise and sleeping. The beds were comfy and the room very clean. My only complaint would be the stains on the carpet. The bathroom was nicely appointed and also very clean. Breakfast is included and offers a good variety from fruits, breads, cereals, eggs, etc. It was served in a pleasant environment however the number of tables are limited so if you come down later in the morning you may have to wait for a table. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our stay was wonderful and a nice start to our 3 week trip. We would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NCtourist
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Stendahl at the beginning of a three week vacation in Rome. We found the rooms to be very clean and well appointed although small by American standards. Our room faced the Via Tritone-a very busy thoroughfare indeed but the noise in the room was minimal. Although our room did have a private balcony, there was no furniture there so it really was not useful at all. It did have an attactive lemon tree residing there! The breakfast included in the price of our room was excellent with plentiful choices to suit any dietary needs. THe location of the hotel was excellent also--within easy walking distance of the Trevy Fountain, Spanish Steps and Via Veneto. Plenty of restaurants nearby for dinner. We appreciated the presence of the bar in the late afternoon for restorative drinks after long days of touring. The desk clerks were helpful in recommending restaurants in the area. We tried three, two of which we could recommend: Tullio and Osteria Romano. The other recommendation given to us--Nautilus--was definitely NOT somewhere we would recommend. It appeared that only other clients of Stendahl were there the night we ate there. I can understand why-- a dark basement with dirty carpet and a menu that was completely uninspired. Skip that one! We regreted that one of our precious nights in Rome was wasted on the Nautilus. All in all, the Stendahl was a great choice for out time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: LTobias
Reviews.Content: I have a little mixed feeling with this hotel. I booked a business room at a promotional rate. But it was still not cheap. Here what I thinkt about my room and the hotel: + Fast check-in and out + Friendly service staff + Nice bathroom with a good shower + Good breakfast (salami, cheese, eggs, cake, marmalade, croissant) + Free internet access (You have to ask for a access code and password if you use your own laptop. This is valid for 24 hours. After that you have to ask for a new code.) + Electronic room safe +/- Good location (But Rome is not big. You can easily walk to the many attractions. Many hotels are in the city centre. So it’s not a big plus.) +/- A quit room with look to the backyard of the hotel. Not a nice view, so I kept the shutter closed. - Very small room for the money. - The advertise on their internet site is not correct. There was no bath robe and slipper in my room. Also no welcome drink. Would I book this hotel again? I don’t know.

Reviews.Title: “great service at the stendhal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the stendhal 13th march for three nights. had a good rate -- of 164 euros a night for a standard room with breakfast. on arrival we were upgraded to a superior room which was superb but noisy, if you stay ask for a quiet room. sheets were changed daily, towels twice daily, king size bed and the best shower i have ever come across. the continental breakfast was lovely and plentiful and the staff excellant. situated 5 mins walk fron trevi fountain and spanish steps, i would certainly stay here if i visit rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Stendhal Hotel - You can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: FoodieDelmar
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 7 nights at the Stendhal, and were very happy with the accomodations. Our room - 601 - was extremely quiet. We did not hear street noise nor any other guests coming or going. The room size was adequate, and the bathroom was great with a wonderful shower. Service, from the front desk to turn down service at night, was wonderful. When we arrived, and our luggage didn't, the front desk made calls to locate our bags. The service at breakfast was very good. There was only one morning where we had to wait for a vacant table, and it was only for a few minutes. The hotel staff were always cleaning, or should I say, polishing an ultra clean property. The location of the hotel is also very good, and within walking distance of all major sites. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue991
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stendhal for 2 nights from 24th-26th Nov 05. Very good location. Walked to all the main sights from here. Good location for restaurants and bars for the evening aswell. Staff very friendly and service impecable. Only drawback was our room was very hot and we weren't able to turn the aircon down so spent the night with the shutters open which was very noisy. Rooms and bathrooms are very small but very stylish.

HotelInfo.Name: Stendhal Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Del Tritone 113, 00187 Rome, Italy
